Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey Brian, you got a sec?

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: Yeah, hold on a sec.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I feel awful.

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: It's fine. It was my first slip up in nine years of miking you. [phone rings]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [in background] Dunder Mifflin, this is Erin.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, thanks for being a good friend.

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: Sure, anytime. Uh, how about you and Jim? Everything squared away?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, mostly.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Pam, phone call.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, hey, say Hi to Alyssa.

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: Will do.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey, boom guy.

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: Oh, hey Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: When are you gonna boom me?

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: Uh, listen, they're cracking down on us talking to the subjects. It's a lame rule, but, you know, I wanna... I, I'll see you later.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Got it.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Hey, so I hear you're bringing in some people to interview for the sales job?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's right, a couple of old friends. Ballers only. Must be this cool to ride.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Well, uh... see, you raised it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, did I? Oh, yes, I did.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wallace is letting me hire a junior sales associate to sit at Jim's desk while he's away in Philly. Finally I'll have someone at my desk clump who gets me. It's like, "Really, Jim? You don't understand the difference between a slaughterhouse and a rendering plant? Uh, remind me not to lend you any dead cows or horses." Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: You know what, man? I deserve this job.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: I scored Stone and Son Suit Warehouse with you, and God knows, to get the Scranton White Pages with Jan, I went above and beyond... and under.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know what? You're gonna get your interview, okay? I know that you're going head-to-head against some real superstars, but you got a really good chance.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Clark has no chance. I mean, he's up against my buddy Rolf, for God's sake. Guy goes fishing with hand grenades. And Trevor - he'll make you laugh so hard, you'll puke your pants.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: This sucks, you know? You put in 12 grueling weeks at a company, and what do they do? They make you compete for a promotion, like an animal. You know, I thought this was an office, not the Thunderdome.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Big changes coming to the old desk clump. No longer a Pam-Jim alliance against Dwight. Now it is Dwight and a friend axis against Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You could've just called that an alliance too, right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I chose my words very carefully.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Things are a little delicate with me and Pam right now. And if my working in Philly is gonna end up doubling the Dwight in her life, that's only gonna make things worse.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: [sighs] You interviewing for the sales job too?

Quote.Speaker: Rolf
Quote.Text: No. You're interviewing for it. I'm getting it.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Well, I wouldn't be so sure about that. I mean, I've been working here 12 weeks. That's a full season of Homeland. A ton of things can happen in that amount of time, as we've seen.

Quote.Speaker: Rolf
Quote.Text: I'm Rolf. Rolf Ahl.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Rolf Ahl? Sounds kinda like Roald Dahl.

Quote.Speaker: Rolf
Quote.Text: Go to hell.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: There he is.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey. Come on, buddy. Let's do this. Sorry, Rolf goes first. You don't compare. When you're with the R-O-L-F, you're literally Rolling on the Laughing Floor. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Rolf
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Rolf is my best friend, and he is the man. Cool, calm, and collected 24/7. Just try and rattle Rolf. I dare you. Such a sweet guy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: When are you talking to David Wallace?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm talking to him this afternoon, but don't get your hopes up.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Too late. My hopes are up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Last week, my company in Philly lost a big investor, so we're scrambling to find new funding. Luckily, my partners have a fix - me asking the boss of the company I'm abandoning to give us a gigantic influx of cash. So... problem solved. Thanks, guys.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And this chair's gonna be yours. And this desk. Ha!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm on the phone. I'm on the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No doy!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm just gonna call you back. Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Dwight knocking on desk]

Quote.Speaker: Rolf
Quote.Text: I hope you like Norwegian black metal, because I don't do earbuds.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [laughs] No earbuds! [both laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm sure he's just nervous.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [sighs] It's fine. It's just a seating arrangement. Doesn't matter.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So I've got your resume here, but it's not telling me everything.

Quote.Speaker: Rolf
Quote.Text: Well, a lot of that information is private. How do I know you're qualified to evaluate me?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, I'm the one offering the job.

Quote.Speaker: Rolf
Quote.Text: What are your credentials?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I've worked here for 12 years. I won salesman of the year. I'm an Assistant to the Regional Manager.

Quote.Speaker: Rolf
Quote.Text: I think I've heard everything I need to hear.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, wait, wait, no, I mean, if you need to know more, you can call David Wallace. I'm sure he'd give a reference.

Quote.Speaker: Rolf
Quote.Text: Thank you, Dwight. I'll be in touch.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, they can't all be winners. But Trevor's next and he's a real professional. You say, "Jump," and he says, "Oh who?" He loves to jump on people, that Trevor.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What makes you think you'd be an effective paper salesman?

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: Ooh, okay. Didn't see that one coming. Can I take a 20 on that? Maybe we can circle back around to it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, it's a pretty basic question for a potential paper salesman.

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: Pass. Next one.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All right. Do you see yourself as more of a team player or a self-starter?

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: No, no and no.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There were only two options.

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: Checkmate. You win this one, my friend. Do you validate parking?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is a bus transfer.

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: [chuckles] Nothing gets by this guy.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Hey Jim, do you mind if I look over these price sheets before my interview?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure, yeah, go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Thanks, dude. You--you sure it's okay? 'Cause you're kinda--

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, absolutely. Do people like sitting next to you? You're clean, right?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Oh, Dove Men.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nice. Music. Do you listen to it in earbuds? You don't listen to it at all because we're at work, not a Florence and the Machine concert, so--

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Yeah, could I just have a minute to prepare for this?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure, yeah. Do whatever you need to do.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Thanks, dude.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right after you do one thing for me. I need you to breathe in my face.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I need you to breathe in my face right now.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: [exhales]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are we working with, peppermint or wintergreen?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Wintergreen.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I knew it, I knew it.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Yeah, good nose.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I looked at you coming around, and I said, "Wintergreen."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can't hire Clark. Yeah, he looks like a Schrute, but he thinks like a Halpert and he acts like a Beesly.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, here's one. A customer who ordered enough paper to qualify for a volume discount now wants to return half the stock. You can't rebate the sales price or credit for future purchases because you brokered the deal for a third party.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: That's just a classic no-win situation.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: So I'd Kobayashi Maru it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Damn it! Perfect answer, again.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Think Dwight, think. You have a ream of 16-bond ...

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: You know what, Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And anoth--

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: This interview's over, and I get the job. I just Kobayashi Maru'd the whole process.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Yeah. Star Trek rules.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It does, but still no.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Come on, man. I mean, did Trevor do that? Did Rolf do that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, you think they're my only friends? I've got way more friends than that, and they're all better than the losers who work here.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [all murmuring]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: This is not natural.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Just - I don't wanna make assumptions based on people's physical appearances.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, of course not, but does physical appearance include smell?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: They smell so bad.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: If I ever get that bad, you'd tell me, right?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Meredith, I tell you all the time.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [chuckles] Walked right into that one.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Next up, my cousin Mose. Mose could make a great paper salesman. He's got a natural fear of paper, which would motivate him to get as much of it out of this office as possible. I've got big expectations, Mose-wise.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What quality would make you a good sales associate?

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: People person.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It says here on your resume that you spent the last 15 years as a sales rep for Dow Chemical.

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: That's right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know we live together, right?

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And I've never seen you go to work, ever.

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So why is this on your resume? [door slams]

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: So how'd you guys hear about the position?

Quote.Speaker: Gabor
Quote.Text: My--my mom.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: Dwight called my house, but he didn't realize that I had already moved out, because my mom and I are quarrelling because I- I can't stay out of her stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Zeke
Quote.Text: Dwight's my cousin, so I overheard him telling my brother Mose about the job opportunity in the shower.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: You were in the shower or he was in the shower?

Quote.Speaker: Zeke
Quote.Text: Everyone was in the shower. It's a cow shower, so there's like, a ton of people in there.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: So you guys all know Dwight already?

Quote.Speaker: Melvina
Quote.Text: I was his babysitter, and then we dated for a while. He was a passionate lover and the sweetest little baby.

Quote.Speaker: Gabor
Quote.Text: I knew you looked familiar. You used to pick up Dwight from school.

Quote.Speaker: Melvina
Quote.Text: You went to X-Men school too? [exhales]

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: X-Men school?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: When I was young, I spent several years at a private school where I was told I would be taught to harness my mutant abilities. Turned out it was a conman copying Charles Xavier's School for Gifted Youngsters from the X-Men comic books. Took me years to figure out that it was a con. Some people never figured it out.

Quote.Speaker: Gabor
Quote.Text: Oh, I have a few powers. Night hearing. Dogs understand where I point. And our training included picking carrots, scrubbing tubs, sewing imitation Levi's. A lot of telemarketing.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't want to sit near any of those people for the next 20 years. Someone say something.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I said something when they were thinking of hiring Jim. Didn't work then. And now look what he's doing to us.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Yeah, Jim, this is all your fault.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How is it my fault?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Here's an exercise for you, Jim. Imagine there are consequences to your actions. Imagine the whole world does not revolve around this. There are others.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But it's Dwight who's bring in all the weirdos.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah, but Jim, Dwight's a weirdo. We can't blame a weirdo for bringing in weirdos. We can blame a normal for creating a situation where a weirdo was allowed to bring in weirdos.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, I'm the one who has to sit next to this weirdo when Jim's away. I'm in a position where I'm rooting for Nate, and that just feels wrong. [sighs] Forget it. I need to work on my mural. I have some pointy trees that I need to round off.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hey Jim, I thought our call was for later.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, this is actually about the new sales guy. Uh, Dwight has brought in a bunch of real weirdos. And I was wondering if I could have some input--

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [presses speaker button] This is Dwight Schrute. Who am I speaking to? And don't lie. I can tell if you're lying.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Hey, Dwight. It's David.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: David.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Jim says he'd like some say in the hiring process.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really? That's interesting. 'Cause I was thinking that since Jim is only here part time, he might not be as invested in the decision-making process as someone like me who's here every day. And frankly, killing it lately.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I was just thinking that because this person is gonna be sitting at my desk, near my wife--

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Jim, another thing. Since we are gonna have to hire this junior sales associate to cover for you, I am going to have to pay you only for the days that you actually work.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh. Um...

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. I can't say that that's not fair.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sounds fair to me, David.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: And I know we have a call scheduled for later -

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, so we'll just do that later.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. Why not do it now?

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Yeah. What's up Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh... [clears throat] Well, it's about Athlead. I'm sorry. Does Dwight have to be on this part of the phone call?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'd love to be in the loop, David.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: It's okay. Go ahead, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There's a very exciting opportunity to be a core investor -

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Okay. Jim, I'm gonna have to stop you right there.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, okay. Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [whispers] I'd love to invest.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'd like to give you $100 million. [snickers] [phone ringing]

Quote.Speaker: Hide
Quote.Text: Why you make trees into bushes? You don't make paper from bushes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hide, they're giving out jobs upstairs. Why don't you go up and get one?

Quote.Speaker: Hide
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [hand dryer whirring]

Quote.Speaker: Troy
Quote.Text: Whoops.

Quote.Speaker: Zeke
Quote.Text: [patting Darryl's hair] It's dense. Like bread.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, you can't just hire someone 'cause they're your friend.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm not. These people are the best of the best. I find talent an attractive quality in a friend.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: They're freaks, Dwight. All your friends are weirdos and freaks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know who else was a freak? Spider-man. And he was also a hero.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Your friends are like Spider-man, if he had gotten bitten by a spider and then got really into masturbating.

Quote.Speaker: Wolf
Quote.Text: Man, how cool is it gonna be when I start working here? Paintball fights at lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mandatory paintball. Uh, wolf, please report to the parking lot for mandatory paintball at lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wolf is hilarious. He has executed me over 100 times at point-blank range. Half of 'em, we were on the same team. Oh my God. How I screamed. Ah, that goof.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sell me this piece of paper. Watch this.

Quote.Speaker: Wolf
Quote.Text: Do you want this paper?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I sure do.

Quote.Speaker: Wolf
Quote.Text: It's not very good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I will pay you whatever it takes.

Quote.Speaker: Wolf
Quote.Text: I think I wanna keep it now. It must be pretty special if you want it so bad.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, you have lots of other pieces of paper that are just like it. So here, just take my money.

Quote.Speaker: Wolf
Quote.Text: Stop trying to get my paper buddy. Okay read my lips. It's over.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. Good. That was great. So. Wow. You're still at the 570 number?

Quote.Speaker: Wolf
Quote.Text: I am.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. Good, good, good. [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Hide
Quote.Text: I have eight years experience selling electronics in Sanyo store in downtown Tokyo. I was a doctor. And I have a business degree from Tokyo University.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This isn't gonna work out.

Quote.Speaker: Hide
Quote.Text: Thank you. [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nate is a proven entity, but not without his handicaps; hearing, vision, basic cognition. Trevor is great, but I saw no fire in him today. And this is a guy who loves to start fires. Troy is literally one of a kind. He's a goblin, or a hobbit, or a kobold, which is a type of gremlin. And yet I'm hesitant. Why can't I pull the trigger on any of them?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [groaning] No, no, no. I just need to tell them. I just need to tell them. [knock at door]

Quote.Speaker: Melvina
Quote.Text: Do you need to be changed?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I do that myself now.

Quote.Speaker: Melvina
Quote.Text: Mm. Are you going to make a decision soon? I've been double-parked for five hours. I'm wondering if I should move my car.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, you've been towed by now. They tow after about 45 minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Melvina
Quote.Text: Well, the joke's on them. I live right next to the tow yard. All they did was save me some gas.

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: Hey man, we get how difficult this is. And no matter how you choose, we're still gonna be your friend.

Quote.Speaker: Wolf
Quote.Text: Yeah, whether it's me or Troy Underbridge, or Gabor, or Melvina--

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Or none of you [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Wolf
Quote.Text: Yeah, you'd bring us all down here, put us through the wringer and then choose none of us.

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: Can you imagine how insulting that would be? The contempt that a person like that would have to have for you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I wish I could hire all of you.

Quote.Speaker: Zeke
Quote.Text: I could start Monday.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Psst. Jim Jim? [whispering] Jim, turn around. Jim, turn around. Jim, turn around.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ahh, I love staring off in one direction. If I'm not looking south, I'm not livin'. That's what I always say.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just act natural. [grunts]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And I was thinking it's only fair that you help make this decision since they'll be sitting at your desk next to your wife.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But you know I wouldn't hire any of these all-stars.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Aah! God, that sucks! Aah! What are you gonna do? I mean, it's your call.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope. Your friends not turning out to be as great as you thought? Not even Gabor?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I guess I just have higher standards for my work colleagues than for my friends. I just couldn't picture any of them in the old gold and gray.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I knew it. You designed a uniform for Dunder Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Summer. Winter. Jungle. Formal.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I for one, was amazed at how qualified everyone was. You?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes. Thank you. Amazed.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And I gotta say, this was a tough decision. And we had to go with none of you.

Quote.Speaker: Sensei Ira
Quote.Text: I'm sorry?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What? This is such bullcrap!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, you know, Wallace put me in charge, so you have no say.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wow. So much crap. It's just a load of B.C. How could you do this to them?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Too much now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: Do we get our resumes back or do you keep them? Because I only have the one, and I have a chili recipe on the back that I really wanna keep.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, this is an outrage. Ugh! You know what? This is Jim Halpert's home address, in case you guys wanna toilet paper his house or whatever.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That seems inconsiderate.

Quote.Speaker: Rolf
Quote.Text: No. We get it. Thanks so much for the opportunity, Dwight. Don't open any suspicious packages you may receive. No, wait. Do open them. Totally safe.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Guys, it wasn't up to me. Rolf, come on. Guys, it wasn't my choice! I would have hired all of you! Gabor, Gabor.

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: Well, my day's shot.

Quote.Speaker: Rolf
Quote.Text: Yeah, it's that weird hour where it's too late to start a slow roast and too early for a Swanson's.

Quote.Speaker: Wolf
Quote.Text: I got it. Paintball.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, that sounds awesome. Can we wait till I get off work?

Quote.Speaker: Trevor
Quote.Text: [yelling] And what are we supposed to do until then?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Wolf
Quote.Text: Let's just go, you guys.

Quote.Speaker: Rolf
Quote.Text: Yeah. No limit on weapons class, right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right. I think that went well.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, uh, if you just take a look at this, and then that'll print out--Hey. Meet your new desk mate.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: What's up good lookin'?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, cool. Hey Clark.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Trust me, this is the least of all evils. It took me all day to pull this off, so you should be thrilled, considering.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I guess. I mean, I kinda liked my old desk mate.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. I'm really sorry I told the guys I'd be there for the board meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Of course.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'll call you when I get there.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Take care of my wife. I will be back.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They say that everyone outgrows their friends at some point in their lives. Well I just outgrew them all in the span of three hours.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Hey, Pam, I'm going to the kitchen. You want anything?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, hey, I'll take a coffee.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sorry. You gotta be this cool for coffee.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [scoffs]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Dwight. Wanna haze the new guy?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Who, me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Us.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Absolutely, I do. [giggles]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. Okay, here. Okay, so the next time he goes to the bathroom, I'll distract him, you take that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, yeah, I know what to do. Okay. Oh, that's great.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [shushes]

Quote.Speaker: Pam & Dwight
Quote.Text: [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Aah!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Welcome to the club, pig! [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Aah!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, it does matter who ends up sitting next to Pam when I'm gone. The people around you are basically who you end up spending your life with. I mean, because of where my desk was, I spent all those years looking at Pam, and I fell in love. So, that stuff matters. Definitely does.
